com.sun.faces.el
Class ELFlash

java.lang.Object
  com.sun.faces.el.ELFlash
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>
public class ELFlash
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>

A Map implementation that provides semantics identical to the "flash" concept in Ruby on Rails.

Usage

See FlashELResolver for usage instructions.

Methods on this Map have different effects depending on the current lifecycle phase when the method is invoked. During all lifecycle phases earlier than invoke-application, methods on this Map are directed to an internal Map that is cleared at the end of the current lifecycle run. For invoke-application and beyond, all operations are directed to an internal Map that will be accessible for all lifecycle phases on the next request on this session, up to, but not including, invoke-application.

Author:
edburns

Method Detail

getFlash

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getFlash()

Returns the flash Map for this session. This is a convenience method that calls FacesContext.getCurrentInstance() and then calls the overloaded getFlash() that takes a FacesContext with it.

Returns:
The flash Map for this session.

getFlash

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getFlash(javax.faces.context.FacesContext context,
                                                                        boolean create)
Parameters:
context - the FacesContext for this request.
create - true to create a new instance for this request if necessary; false to return null if there's no instance in the current session.
Returns:
The flash Map for this session.

getPhaseMap

protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getPhaseMap()

Returns the correct Map considering the current lifecycle phase.

If the current lifecycle phase is invoke-application or render-response, call getNextRequestMap(javax.faces.context.FacesContext) and return the result. Otherwise, call getThisRequestMap(javax.faces.context.FacesContext) and return the result.

Returns:
the "correct" map for the current lifecycle phase.

get

public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object key)

This operation takes special care to handle the "keep" operation on the flash. Consider the expression #{flash.keep.foo}. A set operation on this expression will simply end up calling the put(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object) method. During a get operation on this expression, we first look in the Map for the currently posting back request. If no value is found, we look in the request scope for the current request. If a value is found there, we place it in the map for the next request. We return the value.

In the case of a non "keep" operation, this method simply returns the value from the Map for the currently posting back request.

Specified by:
get in interface java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>
